results.content:
He mentions removing a newline character, but doesn't show how. I spent two hours extra to get his script running due to this omission. This is when he first shows how to take input from a file listing ip addresses of switches.
Other than that, so far it is clear. I hope it gets a lot more advanced before the course is over. We will see.

results.content: My company is just now starting to move towards network automation. As someone with programming experience and little bit of networking knowledge I have learned a great deal from this course. I love that there are small scripts that I can access right away and play around with, but how there are also the videos if I need some clarification on what the Python code is doing. I would highly recommend this course to anyone with some coding experience that is not afraid to get their hands dirty and build onto the material that he's provided. Great course!
results.content_html: My company is just now starting to move towards network automation. As someone with programming experience and little bit of networking knowledge I have learned a great deal from this course. I love that there are small scripts that I can access right away and play around with, but how there are also the videos if I need some clarification on what the Python code is doing. I would highly recommend this course to anyone with some coding experience that is not afraid to get their hands dirty and build onto the material that he's provided. Great course!

Good content so far, but the instructor cross posts videos between YouTube and Udemy, making it unclear at times if I am getting anything in the paid course that is not already covered on the YouTube channel.

results.content:
Dit is echt top! Precies wat ik zocht, praktisch en informatief.

De commando's worden soms wel erg snel uitgevoerd, waardoor je er makkelijk één over het hoofd ziet als je direct mee wilt doen met een labje. Commandos zijn wel bijgevoegd als bijlage, dus dat is echt handig.

Fijn ook dat niet alles meteen in 1x van je wordt verwacht en dat je ook aangeeft dat je erin moet groeien, maar soms wordt dat wel iets teveel herhaalt waardoor je veel naar hetzelfde zit te kijken.
results.content_html:

results.content:
This course is a go-to in case you need a quick way to automate your network. It has plenty of  great examples on how to connect and automate network tasks. This course will teach you how to automate all the repetitive tasks.
However, this course will not provide you with in-depth explanation for the python code, so a basic python is prerequisite for better understanding of the course.

results.content:
This was my first course concerning Python. I have been a network engineer for the last 10 years. This instructor presented python and what it could do for me in a great fashion. Instead of explaining what python is and how it works. He shows what it can do and it makes sense! This kept me engaged and when all the networking example were finished. He goes on to explain the fundamentals of Python. At this point i was ready to learn those fundamentals and learn what else I could do with this newly found knowledge. 

Great Instructor!!

results.content: This is a must have course for any networking engineer looking to get into programming, as every single lecture in the course is focused on getting the most out of python for networking - not software development! Another plus about this course is that David keeps it really interesting throughout by constantly introducing new technologies and methods to improve your coding skills. This course really is different from the rest of the python courses out there, and you really learn something new every lecture, and for that reason, this course is worth every penny!

results.content:
Definitely tricky to rate this 5 stars as it requires certain things up front (Need to FIND or buy cisco VIRL to legally use these images and follow along with the course correctly), also setting up the dockers is tricky and I had to figure out the correct Ubuntu docker since the other ones weren't working. All in all, David is great at explaining and narrowing down exactly what he wants to teach, and thats automation. 
The rest lies on the student...which can be a bit of a turnoff, I admit.

results.content:
David explains things very clearly and not at a too rushed pace.  I especially liked the section on Scaling as it was good to see an example of multi-threading for network programming.

Whilst the content is very informative I do not believe it was presented in the correct way for a Udemy course (hence only 3 stars), it appears to have been originally created for YouTube where a show-and-tell approach is fine. As I purchased the course when it was on offer I believe it was a fair price but I would have been less impressed if I'd paid the full price.

If I were to consider purchasing any more of David's courses on Udemy there are a few things I'd like to see, which add the "Udemy" value to it:
1. Short tests at very points in the course to test value, this feature is available on other Udemy courses.
2. Practical exercises that allow students to apply what they have just learned.  For example after the basics of getting a config and learning how to access multiple devices, an exercise could be to do the same but to retrieve the ARP tables for multiple devices.
3. More taught examples rather than presenting the same thing in different ways.  The section on saving configs for example, was getting very boring by the end. Applying a new technique to a different example would have made this less so. A number of the web development courses I've done use a different project to describe different functions/libraries which would still translate to a more network oriented course as well (check out Brad Traversy and Jose Salvatierra who take this  approach on Udemy).
results.content_html:
David explains things very clearly and not at a too rushed pace. I especially liked the section on Scaling as it was good to see an example of multi-threading for network programming.

Whilst the content is very informative I do not believe it was presented in the correct way for a Udemy course (hence only 3 stars), it appears to have been originally created for YouTube where a show-and-tell approach is fine. As I purchased the course when it was on offer I believe it was a fair price but I would have been less impressed if I'd paid the full price.

If I were to consider purchasing any more of David's courses on Udemy there are a few things I'd like to see, which add the "Udemy" value to it:
1. Short tests at very points in the course to test value, this feature is available on other Udemy courses.
2. Practical exercises that allow students to apply what they have just learned. For example after the basics of getting a config and learning how to access multiple devices, an exercise could be to do the same but to retrieve the ARP tables for multiple devices.
3. More taught examples rather than presenting the same thing in different ways. The section on saving configs for example, was getting very boring by the end. Applying a new technique to a different example would have made this less so. A number of the web development courses I've done use a different project to describe different functions/libraries which would still translate to a more network oriented course as well (check out Brad Traversy and Jose Salvatierra who take this approach on Udemy).

results.content:
Phenomenal course! David is a phenomenal instructor who gets straight to the point by showing you real-world examples from the get-go. David also goes over some Python theory if you need a refresher in these topics or have never had any Python experience beforehand. David goes over most of the important Python libraries for networking. I would have loved to see David cover Jinja2 templates as well as that is really helpful in network automation. 

Thank you David for this wonderful course!
results.content_html:
Phenomenal course! David is a phenomenal instructor who gets straight to the point by showing you real-world examples from the get-go. David also goes over some Python theory if you need a refresher in these topics or have never had any Python experience beforehand. David goes over most of the important Python libraries for networking. I would have loved to see David cover Jinja2 templates as well as that is really helpful in network automation.

Thank you David for this wonderful course!

results.content: This course has boosted my confidence and I just can't wait to bag my CCIE. I ve been trying to learn some programming languages and the confusion always sets in each time I get to the point where it starts looking like I'm being trained to become a developer but I know definitely that's never on the card. I'm only seeking some programming knowledge that is applicable to the networking field where I have always dreamt to be. This course solves that simple problem for me; that is opening my eyes straight to the relevant areas of programming language that's applicable to networking, and more importantly the use of GNS3. Thank u very much David.

results.content: The instructor's tutorials is practical and hands-on and he make sure he hit the nail on the head.I will recommend this video tutorial for anybody who want to go into Network Automation in the future because network programmability and automation has come to stay.Is an essential skills a network Engineers like myself need to have in this generation if we don't want to be left behind in the IT world.

results.content:
When it comes to downloading applications and software, I felt better explanation was required navigating through various websites.

The subtitles are the worst part. 
Eg: for Vlans its shows villans
for GNS3 it shows jenuis
for netmiko it shows miro
and such nonsense stuff. 

Need to work a lot on the subtitles part.

Otherwise the course content is good.
results.content_html:
